text:
I went to uni in Bath  (having grown up around london). Was a great decision for me personally. Most people I know that go spend a couple years away really enjoy it. Brilliant memories and l'll lways remember Bath! Also it was nice not living at home for a bit :laughing: 

Why do you think you might regret it? 

I guess one of the important things for me was making sure it was a campus uni so you get that community feel/life (which I think might still be more likely outside of or on the outskirts of London). Also what's fun about places outside of London (or I found anyway) is that you end up venturing out into the surrounding areas too and exploring with your pals. 

I gotta admit it was a bit daunting the first week or so there but being away from home kind of forces you into making good new additional friends

Have you travelled much so far? Or are you planning on doing some? 

I took a year out after uni to travel. I think it's one of the most enjoyable development experiences I've ever put myself through. I compare it a little bit to the experience of uni. You're out of your comfort zone all the time and constantly learning about people and cultures and it helped me switch from being a little worried about new things to not being able to live without them!  :blush: :ok_hand:
